messages.msgSnippet: I would like to battle him but I would have to have his Wii friend code and he would have to have mine and my Brawl code. Also when you said beat it you
messages.messageBody:
I would like to battle him but I would have to have his Wii friend code and he would have to have mine and my Brawl code. Also when you said 'beat it' you should have used "these" instead. Granville Parham, age 14

Are there any kids interested in battling on the wii with my son Granville? Thanks...Cameron

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] super smash bros brawl
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/14/2008 10:34:45 P.M. Central Daylight Time, sbg1970@comcast.net writes: Arizona is nice. The winters are awesome. The summers are a bit
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/14/2008 10:34:45 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
sbg1970@... writes:

Arizona is nice. The winters are awesome. The summers are a bit too hot for
me. I have lived here for about 17 years and my husband has lived here all
his life ( almost 40 years). The NW side is growning bigger and bigger. It is
very easy to homeschool here...no testing or anything like that.
Where in arizona were you thinking of moving to?
Shannon




Tuscan. there are co housing communities over there that i would love to see
and be a part of. or anything like that. I'm not sure it's hotter than
south Florida though, plus we deal with humidity here. so I'm not sure if sunny
Arizona is much different than sunny Florida except we're very tropical and
have all the hurricane issues to deal with and the year long humidity that makes
it seem even hotter. 2004 and 2005 were particularly harsh on us. our roof
being tossed on our car for one thing. a tree landing in my kitchen a year
later. lol. it's been quiet 2006 and 2007 but our homeowner insurance has bolted
to new heights. well we do live in hurricane valley....

Finance. (http://money.aol.com/tax?NCID=aolprf00030000000001)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] super smash bros brawl
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Juli, Come join us in Arizona! Life is GREAT here in Tucson. And very unschooling friendly! We ve been here since Dec 2000 (moved here from Dallas) and we
messages.messageBody:
Hi Juli,

Come join us in Arizona!
Life is GREAT here in Tucson.
And very unschooling friendly!

We've been here since Dec 2000 (moved here from Dallas) and we love it!

We just recently attended the 2nd annual homeschool conference in Phoenix
sponsored by HENA (http://hena.us/).
It was very unschool friendly and loads of fun.

We belong to two local groups - Sonoran Desert Homeschoolers (
tucsonhomeschoolers.org) and SOARing unschoolers (
http://www.soaringunschoolers.com/).
Loads of parkdays, field trips, festivals, classes, etc.

heather
mom to Quentin, 12, & Sierra, 9 1/2

On Fri, Mar 14, 2008 at 8:22 PM, <autisticcrystal@...> wrote:

>
> Ihow is life in arizona? we've been thinking of relocating there.
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.msgSnippet: My 3 kids have really enjoyed this game; the oldest already beat it and the younger 2 are just loving playing with it.  I wonder if my 14 yo ds could battle
messages.messageBody:
